column4: OK, so when I try to do the do-release-upgrade, I get this error: Your system contains broken packages that couldn't be fixed with this software. Please fix them first using synaptic or apt-get before proceeding.
sudo apt-get install -f
have you added any repos?
try to stick to the repos next time
I did...
you didn't add anything?
try removing it and then sudo apt-get install -f
you'll probably want to sudo apt-get update before the install -f
thanks, even after doing an update, and then doing install -f, it still says its unable to correct dependencies.
haven't pinned any packages?
No I don't think I have.
normally dependency issues are caused by software outside the official repos or purposefully holding back (pinning) packages, i can't think what else could be at fault
where would I go about checking which repo's are being referred to?
post your sources.list
if you are running lucid then only lucid should be there
It is running lucid (10.04) I guess it changed the file on its own trying to go to 12.04.

After changing that file, and doing an apt-get update, when I process apt-get -f install, I get 0 upgraded, 2 newly installed, 796 to remove and 0 not upgraded... should I go ahead and proceed? It looks like its trying to pretty much remove all the software.
wow, when you previously tried to upgrade did it partially go through with it or did you get the warning straight off?
When I tried to do the do-upgrade-install (or whatever the command is) it got part of the way through installation and then failed.
ah, no wonder you had precise in your sources.list then
you should have removed any non-repo software before attempting to upgrade
Yeah, it screwed this system up pretty good! I had an interesting time just getting back into it and getting the / remounted to where I could actually do something with it...
at least now you know for next time
